snippet: The Iraqi site, one of the world’s most important archaeological operations, is a source of priceless antiquities from the Assyrian empire.
abstract: Islamic State militant group attacks ancient archaeological site of Nimrud, dealing a huge blow to historical preservation in Iraq.

byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, Tom Mashberg from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The Iraqi site, one of the world’s most important archaeological operations, is a source of priceless antiquities from the Assyrian empire.

headline.main: ISIS Attacks Nimrud, a Major Archaeological Site in Iraq
headline.print_headline: ISIS Attacks a Major Archaeological Site in Iraq

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
